results.title: The Laws of drag in fluid of high and low viscosity (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Quentin Brown, Kevin Smith and Educational Films Service
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Fluid Dynamics of Drag”.
Illustrates drag at very low Reynolds Number; Stokes Law; drag at high Reynolds Number; similitude low connecting drag coefficient and Reynolds Number; boundary layers; laminar and turbulent regimes.

results.title: Some curious experiments (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Quentin Brown, Kevin Smith and Educational Services, Inc.
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Fluid Dynamics of Drag”.
Professor Ascher M. Shapiro describes experiments to show that in a certain range of speeds the drag of a sphere decreases as the speed increases; that at low speed a smooth sphere has less drag than a rough sphere, while at high speeds it is just the reverse; that stream lining reduces drag in air, but increases drag in glycerine.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Quentin Brown, Kevin Smith and Educational Services, Inc.

results.title: Fundamental concepts (TEFC)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Fluid Dynamics of Drag”.
Professor Ascher M. Shapiro introduces concepts of continuous fluid, density and velocity at a point, body forces, surface forces, pressure, pressure gradient, viscous stress, viscosity; equations of fluid motion; limiting cases of low and high viscosity; Reynolds Number and dynamical similarity; pressure drag, friction drag and total drag.
results.description:

results.title: Russell Drysdale
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Five Australians”.
This film shows personal interviews between Russell Drysdale and Australian author George Johnston. Their discussions centre on Drysdale’s slowly developing portrait of Johnston and closely examine the values and lifestyle of what Sidney Nolan calls “the most Australian painter”. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Rupert Murdoch
results.creator_credit: Ken Hannam, Kip Porteous and ABC
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Five Australians”
Looks at the personal life of Rupert Murdoch the newspaper tycoon, whose career started when he inherited the family company interests. He expanded the business and launched a national paper, The Australian. Members of his family and staff discuss the man they know.

results.title: The National fitness story
results.creator_credit: Alex Ezard, Artransa Park Studios and Shell
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Fit to Live”.
The Federal Minister for Health briefly introduces the “Fit to Live” series, after which the overall objectives and activities of the National Fitness movement throughout Australia are depicted. Story by Noel McDonald with Commentary by David Low.

results.title: Heart of the matter
results.creator_credit: Alex Ezard and Artransa Park Studios
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Fit to Live”.
Part of an instructional film series from 1969-70 about the training of Australia’s youth. Thirteen colour films of ten minutes duration were made under the auspices of the Cultural Council for National Fitness. The films focus on National Fitness Camps, sports, family recreation and exercises for people of all ages. Sponsored by the Shell Company, the films were made to emphasis the need for physical fitness amongst all age groups. This film deals with the prevention and rehabilitation of heart disease through exercise.
